notes.text: A flaw was found in Go. The net/http module mishandles specific server responses from HTTP/1.1 client requests. This issue may render a connection invalid and cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: net/http: Denial of service due to improper 100-continue handling in net/http
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: An attacker would need to control a malicious server and induce a client to connect to it, requiring some amount of preparation outside of the attacker's control. This reduces the severity score of this flaw to Moderate.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.14 see the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for this release, for important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this errata update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.14/release_notes/ocp-4-14-release-notes.html

For Red Hat OpenShift Logging 5.9, see the following instructions to apply this update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.14/logging/cluster-logging-upgrading.html

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: net/http: Denial of service due to improper 100-continue handling in net/http

notes.text: A flaw was found in the go/parser package of the Golang standard library. Calling any Parse functions on Go source code containing deeply nested literals can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: go/parser: golang: Calling any of the Parse functions containing deeply nested literals can cause a panic/stack exhaustion
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:

For Red Hat OpenShift Logging 5.9, see the following instructions to apply this update:

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: go/parser: golang: Calling any of the Parse functions containing deeply nested literals can cause a panic/stack exhaustion

notes.text: A flaw was found in the encoding/gob package of the Golang standard library. Calling Decoder.Decoding, a message that contains deeply nested structures, can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion. This is a follow-up to CVE-2022-30635.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: encoding/gob: golang: Calling Decoder.Decode on a message which contains deeply nested structures can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability in Go's `encoding/gob` package is of high severity because it exposes applications to potential Denial of Service (DoS) attacks through stack exhaustion. Since `gob` relies on recursive function calls to decode nested structures, an attacker could exploit this by sending crafted messages with excessively deep nesting, causing the application to panic due to stack overflow. This risk is particularly important in scenarios where untrusted or external input is processed, as it can lead to system unavailability or crashes, undermining the reliability and availability of services.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in the go/build/constraint package of the Golang standard library. Calling Parse on a "// +build" build tag line with deeply nested expressions can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: go/build/constraint: golang: Calling Parse on a "// +build" build tag line with deeply nested expressions can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
